evidence: Each term in the sum is a complex exponential - and each coefficient, c n, tells us how much of that particular frequency component is present in the signal.

triples.evidence: Each term in the sum is a complex exponential - and each coefficient, c  n, tells us how much of that particular frequency component is present in the signal.

concepts.term: f hat of s equals the integral from negative infinity to positive infinity, of f of t times e to the power negative 2 pi i s t, d t

evidence: At the top, we see a Fourier series representation. It tells us that a function of t - written as f of t - can be expressed as a sum over many terms. Mathematically, this is written as: f of t equals the sum from n equals negative infinity to positive infinity, of c_n times e to the power 2 pi i n t over capital T.
triples.o: the sum from n equals negative infinity to positive infinity, of c_n times e to the power 2 pi i n t over capital T
